title: Aqua Appia
description: The earliest of Rome's aqueducts, the Aqua Appia was constructed in 312 BC by the censor Appius Claudius Caecus. The aqueduct runs a course of 16.4 km, entering Rome at the Porta Maggiore. Frontinus estimated the daily volume at 75,537 cubic meters.

properties.description: Extant remains of above ground portions of the aqueduct. Location based on OpenStreetMap and verified in Google Earth.
properties.title: location of Aqua Appia

properties.description: Subterranean segment excavated and removed during construction of the “C” metro line under what is today the Piazza Celimontana. Coordinates sourced from Google Earth historical imagery dated 10/2016 with reference to photograph in Lorenzi 2018.
properties.title: Imagery Location: aqueduct segment at Piazza Celimontana
